review: I went there to meet a business associate at 3pm on a Monday.  We had drinks and discussion. I thought that the wait staff were perfect in the amount of times they came to the table.  They were not obtrusive, yet when we needed refills they were there. They also did not make us feel guilty that we did not order any food.

I remember the times while in college,  my friends and I were big fans of TGIF. Alas, their glory days appear to be setting into to a dismal sunset. We went here to try to catch some happy hour after shopping at the outlets.  (FYI - they are the only ones in that little center that have happy hour on Sundays...  3-6pm yo).  We were seated promptly and ordered a couple of drinks and a few HH food items... So...the one star in this review is for our server.  He was a sweetheart and genuinely offered good service, to the best of his ability. The food though,  I have yet to figure out what the heck was up with it.  I ordered a baked potato, which was great with the sour cream and chives. The drinks (Zombies) were good too, and priced well at $7. But the shrimp cocktails...we struggled to finish them!  I've ordered it at TGIF before,  but this time they tasted old and defrosted (kinda rubbery) and the ahi chips were old too... stale chips and fishy tasting ahi (oxymoron, I know).  It was terrible.  My fiancé and I felt sick until the next morning!  Definitely a final nail in the coffin for me and my TGIF days.

It's a TGI Fridays, I was not expecting the most fabulous dining experience of my life.  We were "camping" down the street overnight and rode our bikes up for a late dinner.  We thought we'd hit Fridays since they advertise a Late Night Happy Hour.  We got there a bit after 9pm.  That Late Night HH starts at 10pm. Was sort of disappointed in the service in general to start out, it got better by the end of the night, maybe because I got buzzed and stopped caring.  But the first bartender was kind of....bitchy?  Maybe just trying to be "sassy" and it came off wrong.  The other one was nicer.   We ordered wings....traditional.  Off the bar menu.  Would have been super sweet for them to NOT hide the "endless appetizer" menus from us...because had we known, we'd have gotten the boneless wings rather than the traditional ones, which would have been a way better deal, as we could have gotten a few more of them and skipped one of the other things we ended up ordering later. And when my boyfriend (who does not pay as much attention to these things as I do) goes to order a beer at 9:55pm, how about be cool and say, hey, wait 5 minutes and it'll be on Happy Hour!  Just kind of lame, on top of the not giving us the other menu for the wings...seemed like they were steering us away from the offered deals, to get a higher check total...well that doesn't guarantee a bigger tip.  It actually guarantees an average tip.  Because if you were trying to be helpful and cool and point us in the right direction to save a few bucks, then you'd have gotten a better than average tip.   The food is consistent, they have a full bar, etc.

I want to start this review by saying TGI Friday's is my absolute favorite restaurant and I begged my date to take me here. With that being said I want to explain my one star review.  Honestly, if zero stars was an option I would have easily given them zero. My date and I ordered chips and salsa as an appetizer, petite sirloin (medium rare) as his and Jack Daniels chicken as mine. We were there over 45 minutes, and only saw our waitress once (who didn't tell us her name), before we got our food. Which 45 minutes for the main course is fine but we never received our chips and salsa or silverware. His "medium rare" sirloin came and he poked it and it started gushing blood. Don't know why he poked it but he did. He had his food for maybe a minute and the waitress was already out of sight so he eats his side's, which were ok. Waitress finally comes back and he shows her that the food is not medium rare and asks for it to be cooked longer. Comes back 10 minutes later and it is solid brown. Also not medium rare... Chips were stale. Salsa was fine.  My chicken was dry but my salad and potatoes were fine. Side note: the couple beside us ordered endless appetizers as her meal and he ordered a salad and a Jack Daniels burger. She (same waitress) brings out his burger and he told her to take the salad off the bill since he never received it.  Another side note: there was a blonde (long hair pulled back in a pony tail with curl to it), skinny waitress working the same section we were in (sadly not our waitress) who was working her butt off, making sure her customers were happy and attended to. Not gonna lie, she made me jealous.

So I went here on a Sunday afternoon after helping my friend move and I wanted to relax with my friends and have a beer. We saw the great happy hour deals online and said, lezzz gooo.  Soo I really don't feel like writing a long review, but to sum it up, we went in, tried to get a $4 domestic beer and wanted to split the appetizer sampler (both on special menu). It turned out that, even though on the menu it saids the beer is made in Colorado, that it was not technically domestic, and that I choose one of the appetizer that wasn't on the special. So at the point I realized these specials weren't very special. It seemed like you were paying so much just for the environment, so I looked on yelp for somewhere else and found this gem tip top meats.  Tip top meats is right across the street and is one of the best places I've been to. Its an underrated hole in the wall with cheap beer, and huge serving of German meats and sides for under $10. I got roast beef cooked in pork with a salad, French fries, potato salad, a dinner roll and a third of a pitcher of beer for about $13. It was so much I couldn't finish and that's not like me at all. And my god was the meat so so good. Ahh it was amazing. I got the Holsteiner Schnitzel and let's just say it was soo good I decided to write my first yelp review.  Anyways I'm getting bored of typing, but TGIF is over priced and your paying for the atmosphere where you can get basically just as good atmosphere and amazing food form a non-chain delicious hole in the wall right across the street. Thanks for reading. -Spencer

Not the Friday's experience that I hoped for. Yes the food was good but this place was so depressing I couldn't get out fast enough. Typical Friday's menu, steak was great. I never order anything without the delicious JackDaniels sauce.  This is located in the Carlsbad by the Sea Resort. If the atmosphere in the hotel is anything like this restaurant, I wouldn't recommend that either.  On a Friday night this place was a ghost town. No hostess, and the employees were just there to get by. No smiles, hardly any music. It was all just bland and depressing.  They either need to relocate or remodel.

No I know why this place has 2.5 stars terrible service not our waiter but the fact the management can't schedule enough staff for a large party! Waited 45 mins for drinks and an hour for 1/3 of the meals so we couldn't eat together!

I've been here weekends, weeknights, lunch, dinner, happy hour, etc... you name it. Service has always been crappy! They take forever to send a waiter to greet you and even longer to bring your drinks and food out. Even when the restaurant is empty service is horrible! I can think of one time I got a great waitress. Food is bland and almost always over cooked. No flavor and burnt equals no fun! Happy hour drinks barely have any alcohol and too much ice! What the hell?! After a few being sent back, I got tired of telling them what was wrong. Tables are dirty, sticky and so are the seats. I always feel I have to clean them myself before I sit down.  Why do I keep coming back you ask? The Jack Daniels sauce! Thus the 2 stars. This is the only restaurant that I know serves it and I love it! LOL This used to be my happy hour spot with the girls since we love our JD's sauce but after giving them PLENTY of chances to improve, we're moving on. For the price of their food and drinks there are plenty of other restaurants that have better quality food and great service.  Btw, since my last visit there's a new manager and let's just say she's something that rhymes with "witch!" I can see why her employees don't seem to care about customer service. Bye bye favorite dipping sauce!

So we decided to come in tonight. No one in the front to welcome or seat us, and I remembered them having a sign to seat ourselves one time so we did. Made eye contact with one of the servers while we selected a booth so we sat and waited for our menus. He never said "Hi" or smiled at us. 10 minutes go by and we never got out menus while he's walking around and talking to his coworker. Seeing that, we upped and walked out to go where customers were welcomed. If you decide to come to this place, go during the day.. maybe there will be more welcoming and positive servers then. After seeing the reviews and experiencing the rude staff. I suggest this place to undergo new management.

Ate here during happy hour yesterday. We were seated right away, and the place was almost empty. Ashley was our server. I ordered A Dos XX and double shot of Grand Mariner neat. My fiancé ordered a mixed drink which also has GM in it. She brought me my beer and informed me they were out of GM and offered to get me something else. I declined, so she left and came back after she discovered the drink my fiancé ordered could not be made because they were out of GM. So she ordered something else.   I noticed they were offering Cuervo Gold shots for $3ea so I ordered 2 of them. She said she didn't think I could order that because it was happy hour, and should get a well drink instead. I asked what she meant by that.....again she had to go ask. So I asked when I could order the $3 shots. She asked me to show here where I saw that price. I pointed to the huge poster on their wall advertising it. So she went to talk to the bar tender and returned saying the offer is good all day whether or not its happy hour. So I ordered them, and she delivered them with a male with some limes.  She was nice, checked on us often, but not knowledgeable about the bar and promotions.  I had a rib eye steak(I like Filet Migon, but is not on the menu) and it was chewy. The mashed potatoes and seasoned fries were good. Fiance had a chicken dish and she liked it.  All in all, we probably wont be back.

I have no idea why this place only has 3 stars?!?! so my 21st birthday was August 2nd 2014 and I took my mom, boyfriend and about 12 of my friends to BJs at midnight so I could get a shot when I turned 21. apparently they have some ridiculous rule that they couldn't serve me right at 12 so I took the whole crew to fridays! amazing choice by the way. I had two bartenders that helped to make my birthday especially memorable, well kinda;) they were Jason and a girl with shortish brown hair, I believe her name started with a j. they were amazing, super fun and very accommodating to all my friends and me on my 21st. Jason is now my favorite bartender and I LOVEEE going to fridays. it's a fun atmosphere with friendly wait staff, casual place and a great late night happy hour!!!  5 stars for my favorite bar and bartender!

Worst experience ever! Came in at 11pm with 6 teenagers. Hardly anyone there. Ordered sides. Was told it would be 35 minutes...then 45 minutes...maybe more.  Restaurant was hard to find. Service was ridiculous. Left. Got food elsewhere in under ten minutes. And the In and Out was far cleaner! Avoid at all costs! If I could give this no star I would!!!!

Haven't been here in a few years, and dinner tonight made me remember why. Saw the TV add for $10 all you can eat appetizers. Which we found out you pick one and have to stay with that. Or $12 and you could pick from 5 things and switch off whenever you want. It was me and my girl, so we each got an appetizer, The food they brought us after 15-20 min of waiting was wrong, no problem we were hungry and planning to get one of everything anyways. Second round some random waitress brought us some wrong wings, ended up being for a different table, 20 min later finally got the right food. 3rd round was the correct food also but had to wait another 15-20 min to get it. Out of everything the only thing I thought was good was the cheese sticks. Waitress wasn't the best service I've ever had but she was nice and despite disappearing a few times wasn't too bad.  We went on a Monday night at like 8pm I could understand the wait time if it was the weekend but seriously on a Monday? Won't be going back For the same price I would have been much happier at BJs or Karl Strauss which are a very very short drive from tgi.

Initially I was going to give this place one star.   All because of the manager (FW/40 heavy set with red hair in a bun).  She was so rude. We had a party of six and told us the wait would be 25-30 min.  We asked if we could sit at the bar and she said no.  In LA kids can sit at the bar with their parents & I understand that Carlsbad has different rules.  But as I walked away she gave me the dirtiest look.  We walked outside to see if everyone wanted to wait.   I walked back in and told her we would wait.  This was at 7:45pm.  8:15pm another member of our party asked how long it would be and she told him at 8:30.  Before it was 25-30 min now it's exactly at 8:30,, 45 min.  How could they know for the table would be ready exactly at 8:30? I didn't mention how empty the restaurant was or how people after us had been seated before us.  The other member of our party told them we would split our party but of course our table was ready.  When she seated us we saw an elderly couple that had come in after Us was seated in a booth for 8 people.  That's when I knew the manager was being an AH.  Our server was a really nice girl who did a great job with juggling tables and the bar.  The food was ok.  The steak seemed as if they were preheated.   The manager is suppose to be the rock of an organization but instead she was the problem.  Maybe you should invest more into your managers so employees can have a better example.

My family and I came here on Saturday night while in town for vacation. We understood there would be a wait, and were quoted at a 20-25 minutes for a table (party of 8). After waiting about 40 minutes, we checked in with the hostess and were told it would be another 15-20 minutes. They told us that the kitchen was backed up, and even if they sat us in 20 minutes though, we wouldn't get our food for at least another hour. ARE YOU F-ING KIDDING?? 2 hours for food after being told 20-25??? We were swindled and robbed of our time. We had 6 hungry adults and 2 starving children.  It was a terrible mess, and a complete waste. Needless to say, we told them to forget it and we went down the street to eat at In-n-Out. Had we known service would be so terrible at TGI Friday's, we never would have stepped foot inside. Not recommended, will never be back.

Came in before going to the flower  field  and took a few min to get a sit. That seemed  kinda weird  since at an earlier  time i usually get a sit rite away. But anyways  i ended up getting  the unlimited  appetizers  and it was good. The wings were kinda hard  other then that everything  else was good.

Went here for my anniversary because I wanted to try the endless apps. Husband got the fish and chips, it was $11.99 but it was alright. No coleslaw was given, just cod fish and fries with tartar sauce. It was good when it first came out but once it got cold, the fish was no longer good and it tasted like it came from a freezer. I am a appetizer addict and was super excited to try endless apps. It's $12 for all you can eat but the selection is limited. I would prefer to come during happy hour than try endless apps again. The app selection is mozzarella sticks, potstickers, flatbread chicken, loaded baked potato skins and boneless wings and that's it. You can only order one app at a time. Happy hour is a lot better because the selection is more and I believe it's half off. Overall, the potato skins were definitely better than usual and the food was decent for the price. Will probably come back, but during happy hour pricing.
Still havnt heard back grom corp management re: there poor seevice and ruining my new purse

We found out that happy hour was all day Sunday with half off most appetizers as the hook that drew us in.  Our waiter was great, positive personality, really helpful, attentive and overall a pleasure to have at our table - but the food was way below our expectations. The spinach dip tasted like it  was diluted with water, wings were tiny and hard as if they had been in the deep freeze for years. Sliders were a decent size, but size isn't the same as quality. The flat bread topped with pesto and tomatoes was HORRIBLE. I can't believe they let these leave the kitchen. I would've given 1 star, but i had to add another because our server was so great.

Worst service EVER! When we arrived (11:30 am) the host looked inconvenienced when we asked for a table. Waited FOREVER for our server to come by.  Them waited 40 min for our 1/2 sandwich and salads to come. The server Luis never stopped by! We had to ask someone else for a side of ranch, which also took 10 min to arrive! In the end I felt like we inconvenienced them! The food was good but the experience wS AWFUL ! I was embarrassed to bring my sister-in-law here!  :( If no stars were an option I would've chosen that!

This place is the WORST! They don't deserve this one star at all. My family and I stopped here while visiting Legoland for my nieces and daughters birthday. We were seated quickly and after about 10-15 minutes someone came to get our drink order. Mind you, this place was a ghost town, so i'm not really sure what took so long. After getting our drinks we waited almost 20-25 minutes before our hostess took our order.  After another 25-30 mins went by and we asked about our food as our host passed our table and she looked confused ... like, when did you people get here?! The food was barely warm when it arrived and they forgot some of our plates. We asked for 2 birthday sundaes and they forgot one and only sang Happy Birthday to one of the two birthday girls. Our kids were falling asleep at the table so I didn't even ask that they bring another sundae in fear that we might be waiting all night. When we finished we waited around for a check and ONE to-go box... literally looking for anyone to flag down but they were no where in sight. I really think they were all back there drinking. After another 20 mins the hostess came back with a half ass apology and excuse about how busy she was. (reminder... there is about 2 other small groups in there with us). The to-go box came 10 mins later after our hostess gave ours away to the next table, who had just sat down to order lol. This place was ridiculous!! And not worthy of the $15.00 they charged us for gratuity.

uhhhhhhhhhhhhhhgggggggggm stomach! Pros: lots of TV's, umm convenient the freeway(?).... Cons: endless apps are hidden unless you specifically ask for them.  boneless wings must be fried 4 or 5 times as they're still with me a week later.  Potato skins were not good.   Drinks were WAY over priced and if memory serves they've had issues with Smirnoff being sold as top shelf.  Really pretty run down, dark n seedy for  what is to be a trendy place. Do yourself a favor, BJ's is 1/4 mile up the road, spend your money there.

Food was outstanding,  service on point. Some older lady was wearing really powerful perfume that was taking our breathe away so the waitress moved us right then and there! The jack Daniels chicken and shrimp was really good the her turkey burger was huge!

I am going to have to say that this might have been the best of not THE best experience I've ever had at a T G I F because from the moment we walked in the door until the time we left, we received nothing but the upmost best customer service! I really wish I could remember the waitresses name that served us but long story short me and my significant other stopped in to get a quick bite to eat around the happy hour time frame! 2 long islands that were made to perfection! Not those watered down happy hour kinda drinks! They hooked us up for sure! The nachos we had were amazing! All under $20! Very well worth it! Sad to see others experiences weren't as good but we most definitely enjoyed ourselves! If I ever visit this area of San Diego again I will be stopping in!

This is the worst TGIFs to go to.  The servers are either crazy, slow/sluggish, or creepy.  The last time we came here around 12:45AM, they closed the kitchen!  The bartender seems to make good mudslides, but I can't get over how weird the service is here... Also, the man had a near sh!t fit when we got dirty share plates with the appetizer.  They looked like they came out of a bus boy's dirty dish tub, so I don't blame him for raising a stink.  The server handed us a new set of plates over the bar area, but didn't seem too remorseful over giving dirty stuff out... so not only is the back of the house negligent, the front seems a bit apathetic. Usually, I'm all for TGIF's (see La Jolla & the soon to come San Bernardino), but the Carlsbad staff needs to step up their game.  Please, show concern over your guests... I'm not the only one along the rows of tables that looks dissatisfied/concerned.
Had a great time here for Valentine's Day the food was good and the place was very clean. The waiters were very nice as well

SERIOUSLY... ! We like to try to be understanding when people make mistakes - but when the server doesn't put the order in .. Then realizes he didn't ... WHY CANT THE ORDER THEN GO AHEAD OF ALL OTHERS IN THE QUE?   The manager is not ept in either social niceties or manners ... How about saying 'we're SORRY!!'

We came in on Valentine's day to celebrate my hubby birthday . There wait time was 25 minutes and they got us in 20 minutes.  We ordered are drinks they where good and took 10 minutes  . When we place are order , we order appetizers and entre at the same time . Are food came first , then are appetizer . They bought us  are side late . They sang to him . Which was sweet . Food was good .

From the start the atmosphere was funky. The girls at the front seemed nice, then they told us there was a wait, Which was odd cus the parking lot was empty. They proceeded to seat us in front of the bathroom you could hear the toilets flushing which left nothing for the imagination. I wasn't too pleased with the seating assignment. We met our waiter and he gladly moved us to our preferred location. He was super nice and accommodating.  He too was a little funky, he seemed to be high energized and quick. He was on top of our drinks, orders and our meals came out promptly. He even informed us about their rewards program which got us a free appetizer.  The inside of the restaurant was dark, dingy and out dated. The overall experience was ok. Not good enough for me to visit again tho.

Trust these reviews. My husband and I used to love going to TGIF for the food.  The service- poor. Everytime we walk through the door we wonder is the Host going smile or greet us this time? Usually they stare at us until we tell them there are two people standing in front of you that would like a table. We always feel awkward until we are seated.  Servers -average. With the exception of Dana. He is awesome. Very friendly and clearly a hard worker.  Just some advice for tgif carlsbad. You are getting paid to give great service. Just smile, greet and thank your customers and I'm sure you wouldn't only have 2 stars on YELP.

Maybe not come here. I ordered the muddled blackberry Margie and it was three different drinks each time with the second one a syrupy mess and the third one too sour. As mentioned by others, the place was half empty but there was a wait list. I was told it it because the kitchen cannot keep up. It was weird to see so many empty tables. Is the kitchen too small? Staff did seem to be trying. Not sure what's up here, but it's an awkward place. I did get the message that the meat tended to be on the rare side and i ordered medium and I liked it because it was like medium rare which is ok by me.  Sirloin steak at sizzler is a bit better and cheaper. Islands is across the street.

So I walked into the restaurant and the first thing I saw was 2 cockroaches reproducing in a baby chair. Then I saw a server picking his nose and flick it. I think that's what's drawing these horny insects. Finally I go to use the powder room and there was a turd in the urinal. Kinda gross. But at least our server was nice and helpful

The windmill that sits perched above the I-5 freeway at the Palomar Airport Road exit is one of the iconic symbols of Carlsbad.  It's a landmark that symbolizes the fact the Flower Fields, Premium Outlets and Legoland are nearby as well as the miles of sandy beaches.  Unfortunately, the TGI Friday's that's connected to this windmill is a tourist trap chain restaurant that's full of wife-beater clad families and crying babies.  Honestly I've never seen a restaurant with more whaling babies and birthday celebrations (I heard at least five while we were there) as this one. I've come here a few times since I live in Carlsbad but this last time was the last time.  I knew it was going to be rough when we sat down on a completely wet booth seat.   Clearly they wiped it down but it was soaking wet.  We only had one set of utensils.  I had to steal some from another table. We decided to go balls-to-the-wall and order steak, lobster, ribs, pizza, and a burger for our family of four.  The food (at over $20 each for the steak/lobster/ribs) was over-cooked, bland and tiny.  I could barely scrape any meat from the lobster tail.  The rib-eye I ordered was puny and tasteless.  I could get a one-pounder at Stater Bros. for $4.99 and cook it myself in half the time it took for the food to come out.  I don't get it.   The drinks were over $8 each and lacked much alcohol.  I would have even taken  the rubbing alcohol version we've heard about in the news if given the choice but no such luck. The bright spot was our waiter.  I can't remember his name (he was a young african-american guy) but he was very nice, had a great attitude and was very attentive.  It's a shame he has to work in this dump. He should move next door to BJ's.  We tipped him well despite the food.

Pretty much what you expect at a TGIF...the food was good, although my burger took quite a while to show up.  The bartenders were attentive, which was nice.  The bar area as well as the restaurant interior could use some serious upgrades to its look/décor as it appears like the company has not done anything to them for the past 20 years or so.

We walked in, three parties before us waiting for tables. 20-30 min wait. I looked and the place was empty, big location but must have been short staffed. Employees were not outgoing at all. Food was ok. I got the French dip. Au jus was only half full, my daughters kids meal had more fries than I did. We saw at least six servers. So I'm not sure how short staffed they were. On good experiences I've had at other restaurants managers always came around to check on table, no manager came around. Server was pretty friendly. Mother in law said barrel chicken was too peppery and they did offer a substitute. Bathrooms were a disaster too.

My wife and i came by this place because ita "friday fun night" and what better fun than going to a restaurant?! And with fridays, you cant fail! So far, we are having great service with the waitress being very atentive and making sure we have enough to drink. I got a long island and decuded to not get a second, but she did offer! I got my clam chowder that made my wife jealous she didnt order one when the smell hit her nose. I ordered the philly stacker or something like that with some homemade chips.  and my wife got a steak, baked potato and broccoli.  The burger eas sooo awesomey! It has the taste of the philly cheesesteak with the nice and comfy burger. And the chips were a lot beter and not as hard as most house chips. Blessing to my fresh dental work!  And my wife's steak was according to her..no comment! Lol! She still enjoying and seeing from her smile, its great!  The server was prompt with our bill too! Always a good thing when you are in a hurry!

I absolutely HATE giving any TGIF's such a mediocre (at best) rating, but our experience here deserves nothing more. I adore the TGIF franchise; having been a patron ever since I can remember, my family and I have enjoyed consistently great service at every one we've encountered. This location is a sad exception. The FK and I did come in a bit early, I must say, but apparently SO early that we could not be seated at a barside table. Fair enough. We understood and decided to sit at the bar itself. When our bartender/server was around, she was very friendly and okay on efficiency -- but I did notice a lot of extracurricular socializing with other employees. Now, I get it, I used to work in the biz and I know that opening can be a total downer. But when it comes at the expense of serving customers -- it's a huge no-no. Both the FK and I had to wait at different times to request different things, which made it even MORE awkward because we essentially were the only people in here. To make matters even worse, we saw other patrons seated at the barside tables shortly after our arrival. There wasn't even any attempt by that vapid cute little hostess to address us after the fact. Ugh. I hate that. To sum it up for you all: even a decently priced all-day happy hour (on Sundays) is not worth the grief coming in here. The entire place is suffering from complacency, riding the coattails of being a TGIF and also receiving automatic clientele from an attached hotel. The whole experience is just awkward and meh.

I ordered the Sizzling Steak with tomatoes and mozzarella. I don't think I have been ripped off this badly in years. It cost $15.00 and was the tiniest meal I have ever seen. A 3 inch diameter of meat was placed on a thin bed of spinach and zucchini. The "side salad" was a few tomatoes and hunks of mozzarella. I laughed when I saw it and am mad that I accepted it. Meal was meh... Servers, however, were very attentive and nice. Oh well...never again.

Worst Friday's food ever had.  Had the French onion soup and chicken strip lunch.  Soup like dirty water, no seasonings. Had an entertainment book coupon.. didn't let us use.  Oh well.  Will not go back there again.  No wonder place was empty...

Glad to read I am not the only one who found this place to be disgusting and got a hair in their food! Table was sticky, menu had crusted food on it and I ha d a nice long piece of black hair waiting for me underneath my shrimp!  Plus there was a 25 minute wait when half the tables were empty. Our waitress was sweet and you could tell she felt bad about the hair but the manager still tried charging us for my meal even though I didn't hardy touch my replacement plate.   The location of this place should've been a given on the cleanliness.  Its in an old run down banquet hall with the actual entrance pretty hidden if you don't know where you are going.  It is going to take me a long time to ever eat at any Friday's again.

Came in here for date night with the hubs. So, I'll start with the good first. Our waitress was attentive, sweet and hard working. I think based on our wait time, they are understaffed. My Cosmo was OK, not quite tart enough. Maybe that's what I get ordering a Cosmo at a place that's pushing their tropical drinks, lol.Their wedge salad was one of the BEST I've had, and I've had a lot. Both the hubby and I loved it. Now to the bad. The hostesses have major attitude, NOT cool! Our dinner which was the steak and lobster, was OK. Steak was good, lobster was overcooked, served burnt almost inedible. The mashed potatoes were OK, as was the tomatoes and mozzarella .

Bad customer service! I came here after work with a large group on a Friday afternoon. It took about 10 minutes to get our drinks. I ordered some appetizers. It tasted good. After we were done with our first round of drinks, our waiter was not sight to take more orders. One of us had to find our waiter. Ridiculous! The waiter suppose to be waiting on us. Moments later the manager appears and apologizes to us. After I was done with my second round, I decided to get my check. The other people in my party were not done yet, but this waiter decides to get everybody else's check. Rude! I should have complained to the manager to remove the automatic gratuity.

Worst service ever. Sat at the bar and 3 people were seated and served their food before we even got our appetizers. There is a reason this TGIF is slow on a Friday at happy hour.. because its a horrible place to go. If you want to go out. DONT GO HERE.

Got food poisoning here a few years ago and thought I'd already done the review. Parents and I came in right before close and were ready to go somewhere else when we saw their hours, but they insisted we come in. I got a coke and a turkey sandwich on ciabatta. The bread was waxy, the meat seemed kind of slimy, and I obviously didn't finish the food. Next day I was laid up worse than I've been since my week long flu in the second grade. Couldn't keep anything down for days. Diners beware!

The management should be fired! The kitchen is behind so they put anyone that comes through the door on a 40 minute hold? The place was empty except the tiny bar area. 40 people MAX in this area and nearly everyone had their food! This location should lose their franchise license. Hire competent managers. Ridiculous.
Food was tasteless. French onion soup was just broth hardly any onions. Clam Chowder sub par. Kids meals very late even after reminding the waiter.

We walk in in the restaurant is empty thought we would get good service since there wasn't any customers wrong sat for about ten minutes until a bartender acknowledged us and dropped off two menus or should I say threw two menus at our table and walked away didn't even greet us or anything. Five minutes later comes back and says what you want to drink I am like are u serious not even a welcome or anything. Stood up and said with that attitude we don't want anything to drink have a good night and walked out. Seriously if you don't like your job just quit please. Worst bartender ever.
Good  service and great food my kids where very happy with our waitress and she was awesome. My kids had not been here before and loved the food

Went on a Monday night with husband around 6:15 and stayed for an hour.  Was able to get there before the dinner rush came in, so we were sat promptly by Malachi, the manager and greeted immediately by our energetic server, Amanda. Order: Appetizer: Pretzel sticks and beer cheddar dip = Delicious! Main: Sizzling sirloin and spinach = Delicious!            Jack Daniel's Burger = Good, a little bland without the sauce Great fries! Sides: Spinach = Delicious! More spices on the side of spinach.              Parmesan steak fries = Delicious! Desert: Tennessee whiskey cake = Delicious! Taste like German chocolate, carrot cake, cinnamon, and caramel. Drinks: Orange Creamsicle in mason jar= Delicious!               Chocolate coffee = Delicious! Ask to have chocolate drizzled on the bottom of the cup and add cream. Best fast food coffee Food seemed as though it was brought out as soon as it came off the grill. Piping hot steak (Medium rare to perfection) and burger. Pretzel sticks were warm in the mouth but didn't burn. Was check on by multiple employees for refills but yet given enough privacy to enough a wonderful dinner with my hubby. Left a 20% tip for the lovely Amanda. The tip percentage at the bottom of the receipt was an excellent resource that helped us know how much we should leave. No thinking necessary!

Nasty. Stopped by tonight (Monday) at 8:30. it was very empty but we still had to wait to sit down. Went to the restroom and BARF! It was DISGUSTING toilet paper all over the floor, toilets full of crap.. just disgusting. Service was slow concidering the time and the fact that it was empty. Food was bleh. You could tell it was all re-heated. I was embarrassed because I took my out of town guests there.  Avoid this place. Its dirty, bland and over priced. I only hope their kitchen is cleaner than their restrooms.. yuk. So Dissapointing for such a beautiful city

Not being from this area, I jumped on yelp to read the reviews. I decided to go because I've never been to tgif. Waited less than 5 minutes to get seated, food was brought out in an appropriate amount of time. The server frequently checked on us. I was there for a total of 40 minutes, I was really pleased I didn't have a horrible experience.

45 mins to get seated (empty tables all over & the hostess blamed that they were training in the kitchen), got our appetizers quick (which tasted horrible), and then took another 45 mins to get our dinner (which was over cooked, slimy and bland. Complained to the manager which she said she was fairly new there and that she's been getting lots of complaints and laughed about it. At least she took $50 off the bill. Clearly the owner needs to clean house here and fire everyone from the wait staff up! We will never visit this establishment again!!

It looks like Friday's management is clueless.  The past few visits have been bad.  All the good bar tenders are gone, the foo and service sub par.  We went for dinner on Memorial Day.  Sat at the bar, took 5 minutes just to get served.  After another 10 minutes we were told it would take 50 minutes for food! The bar had about 8 guests and the restaurant was not even full. We won't be back anytime soon.

Service is always a little slow, but it's because they are usually pretty busy and only have one or two servers on for the entire bar. The drinks and food are worth the wait. Can't go wrong with their happy hour drinks and 1/2 off all apps!! Whenever I go I sit with Luis in the bar because he always takes great care of me and my friends. Carlos is a great bartender and always super friendly too! They are open till 2am so it's definitely convenient for us in the food industry. I am a regular here and love it!

The food is typical Friday's food- and that's what earned them one star.  It's decent food.  I've never had bad food at any location but the service is atrocious here. We arrived at 5pm (before the dinner rush started- by 5:30, there was a waiting list) and we sat and waited and waited for out server, Tyler, to greet us.  We even asked the hostess about 10 minutes into our wait if our server knew we were there.  She said he did.  We must've sat for a good 15 minutes until he came over.  Once he came over, we ordered our drinks and meal in one fell swoop. Minutes later, our son's dinner came out (as we requested) and then our meals came out not too long after. This is when Tyler just vanished into thin air.  We were never offered refills (we had to flag another server down), the same server brought us our check (after we flagged him down again). We saw other servers hustling and bustling, but Tyler was just taking his sweet ol' time.   Wish I would've read the reviews before coming here.  Lack of service tends to be a theme here.

Staying at the Carlsbard By Sea resort,  Fridays is located within the premises thought it be an easy dinner run. When we arrived we were excited to see many tables open. Am traveling with 3 children under 10yrs and they were hungry. We get there and the 2 hostess tell me I have to wait 45 to 50 mins. I ask why and very rudely I get told because they had been busy with a 20 guest party the past 2hr and need to slow down the kitchen down. I understand if there's no table but the whole outside deck and majority of floor is open. The kids don't want to sit on the floor in the waiting area since there isn't enough chairs and everyone else is also waiting with kids. The attitude of the hostesses was the deal breaker. Am used to waiting am from L.A. but a "sorry you have to wait" makes a huge difference when your being told there's a long wait.

Awful service, the tables around us were dirty and never got cleaned in our time there, food was pretty bland but that's just chain restaurants I guess. Our server didn't tell us specials or happy hour info, walked away in the middle of a conversation when we asked about prices- I think he went to look up the answer and then just didn't come back. Don't go here. Go to chili's.

I wish I could put a 0 star. I was staying at Carlsbad by the sea and I ordered room service from this place. It was a simple order, burger no pickle or tomato. I waited 20 minutes and guess what it came with pickle and tomato. I cannot eat anything with pickles on it so I called and they made me another on which came wrong as well. I do not understand how you get such a simple order wrong twice. I didn't even call back the second time and just went without eating. Please if you are staying at the hotel or thinking about going there thing again and go somewhere else.

I've only been here a couple times and can't recall too many details but recently my husband and I met some friends for late night happy hour around 11:30 pm and had a great server (Luis). The drink specials were affordable. The food was tasty - especially the Jack Daniel's boneless wings - ummm I'll just have a massive plate of those, please. Not sure about the daytime service; from what I read on Yelp it doesn't seem too hot so maybe late night is the best time to go :)

We had such a horrible experience here that we waited more than a year before returning. The prices have always been reasonable but the food and service is hit or miss. Well, they seemed to have missed the boat completely but at least the service and the food are finally congruent: they both suck! We waited for almost 30 mins for a seat in a nearly empty restaurant - only to be in tilly ignored by the wait staff - then after finally being able place our order - served food that looked and tasted like it came straight  from the leftover/throwback/ day old shelf. Really disappointed in the quality (or rather lack thereof) of food and service. Staff however, are really into each other as evidenced by the way they stopped to give each other lingering hugs and openly discuss their plans to party later. Wow!

Ridiculously bad service, just horrible! Stopped on my way home because it is right off the freeway.  Sat at bar with maybe 6 other people.  Took 10 minutes to get one drink order and menu.  An hour later I'm sitting here no checking in or order taken.  The bartender looked my way 20 times, but nothing.  So to see how long I'm sitting here another 30 minutes with my credit card waiting to pay.  Smh ridiculously horrible service.  Then after a bar tending assistant takes my card to run it the bartender finally asks if I want another drink ignoring anything else.  I should have known better than stop here!!

I should have looked at the reviews! Had to find a worker and ask if we get seated or seat ourselves. It was dead so you think the service would be good. Steak tasted like it had  freezer burn cold fries  ! Will not be back to this place

Do yourself a favor and don't come here. Guaranteed this place goes under in the next 12 months. Service was truly awful. Even worse than what I'd expect from a dumpy low-brow watering hole. Both our drinks came out completely wrong and tasted like diabetes in a glass (since when does a Manhattan appear neon yellow?!). Just disgusting on multiple levels.
Horrible.. Service was bad, waited so long for everything, the food was dry... Overall horrible...

Bad nachos. Platter only half filled. 1 tablespoon of guac. Hardly any cheese. Mostly burned chips. Service crap. Told us they were busy. Didn't look busy to us. Overcharged for item we didn't have would like a re-do on yodays lunch choice.

Okay so I have to break this one down and tell the whole story so you can understand my review..... I do like TGIF I really do although it has not always been a convience near by so I usually will go to its competitors such as Applebees or Chillis etc....Anyhow on Veteran's Day just like a lot of places they had a special going.  Buy one get one free for Retired and Active Duty.  Being a military brat and now a spouse of an active duty member I know these kind of deals are great but expect a wait.  We had no problem waiting 2 hours for a meal it was the staff that was the problem.... When we arrived we were told it would take 20-25 mintues for us to be seated....a lie.....We knew in our heads this will at least be an hour to two hour wait no problem.  We sat and chit chatted while waited to be seated.  After an hour passed we were still fine waiting but the hostess decided to cut in our conversation and tell us she thinks we should leave because it is going to be another two hour wait plus and additonal hour and a half to get served.  We were shocked since we were not complaining and minding our own business relaxing,  Why she was so rude and wanting to kick us out?  We go offended and left upset.  I also want to not the hostess did this to several other people as we were waiting. I think the object should of been to maintain costumers not boot them out the door especially after an hour of waiting... Anyhow, The next day I called the manager and he was also upset about what happended.  The only reason why I am giving this place 3 stars is because he totally made it up to us.  We able to come in the next day and receive a complimentary dinner on the house with the works.  kudos for the manager thumbs down for the hostess.  Our service the second night was great! And I was glad the manager made sure we were taken care of and went out of his way to see smiles.   We also noticed other customers were receiving this great treatment as well.  I think this experience on this particular day was a growing one for the location and it will help them improve thier staff.  So would I go here again yes....was it pleasant the first time no but hey everyone deserves a second chance and I am glad we took them up on the offer.

I went there yesterday. We sat at the bar around 7 pm, but it wasn't busy, less than 10 customers. There were 2 bartenders and we didn't get a menu for almost 15 min until my boyfriend asked for it. I really wanted to leave since they don't wanna take care of us, but didn't have that much time and don't wanna ruin our date. We finally got our drinks.and foods. The bartender who wears a red shirt were busy talking with a manager and not pay attention to customers at all. The food was ok, but the service was horrible. I told my boyfriend not to leave the tips, but he felt bad to a girl bartender because she helped us. I was really disappointed with their service. Last time I came here was 3 years ago and sat at the table and a server were very attentive and productive. I doubt coming back here unless they change the management and.don't sit at the bar!!!

The worst burger ever!! I order the all American stack burger and it came looking like a quarter pound with cheese. The sad part is A quarter pounder would have had more meat on it. It also was suppose come with peppercorn bacon expect for it came out with thinly sliced bacon with no peppercorn. The bun looked cheap. My husband and I were really looking forward to eating here but we will never return. So sad!! This Friday's Looks like  a ghost town for told people. That burger  should have been on the weight watcher menu.  If I wanted weight watchers I would have gone to subway!

I wish I could give less than 1 star.   We went with my in-laws who for their last night in town dinner.  6 of us total.  (our children)  This is not a restaurant we normally go to and this was MY 1st time there.   My mother in-law ordered wine...took 15 minutes for them to tell us they were out...she ordered a different glass and that took 15 minutes to get to our table...that was JUST the beginning.  We all ordered something different.  1 item from the children's menu...I'll start with that.  My son actually asked "how big is the burger?"  He was VERY hungry and would have ordered off the adult menu if the waitress didn't assure him that the childrens cheese burgers were "HUGE" and it would fill him up.  He is small for his size and age (11) but I told her he has a larger appetite than he looks.  Again, she assured us the burger would be enough.  It wasn't even close.  It was plain and she rolled her eyes when he asked for ketchup...ayfkm?  He cleaned his plate and ate most of my veggies...and we will wrap back to those in a moment.   My husband ordered a Reuben sandwich...now there are 3 - arguably 5- things that make a Reuben a Reuben.  Corned beef, thousand island and sauerkraut -rye bread and provolone cheese..but whatever.  His came out with zero sauerkraut....but a TON of grilled onions.  Not that big of a deal...but he WANTED the kraut.  So he asked for some on the side.  10 freaking minuets later they let us know that they were completely OUT.  He was pissed.  So he sent it back.  The manager came over and said the kitchen was upset that he didn't like it but that he had started to eat it.  (he took 2 bites)..how many freaking people inspect to make sure their order is correct?  Yeah, that is dumb.   At this point the rest of the food had finally come out...yeah, it came out one plate at a time.   He ordered an app and said he wasn't happy with the Reuben and wouldn't be paying for it.   My father in law's pasta was cold...and not just sitting on the side waiting to come out cold...like freaking frozen in the middle COLD.  My mother in laws steak was over cooked so she sent it back...they cooked it through...she just ate it.  My older sons ribs were UNDER cooked and we sent those back.  I am just going to skip my salmon...but you get the idea.   The manager convinced us to order cheesecake.  I asked how big they were...here we go again...I'd prefer for the children to share.  But she insisted the slices were tiny...so they both got their own...they are HUGE.  ha of course.  I did have a bite as well as my husband and the cheesecake was very good...the only thing that was.     NOW for the check...they had the wine they were out of on there...claiming I had a glass.  HAHAHHA no - I didn't...I had water, not wine.  The Reuben was on there as well as the app and cheese cake...nothing was comped.  All the problems we had and sending so much back and they didn't even comp us the cheesecake the manager said we would.....My husband now was LIVID...and still hungry.  The manager came over and took the check.  We had to negotiate the damned check.  wine (that they were OUT OF !!!) should come off, Reuben OFF, and at least 1 cheesecake.  She wasn't happy but she ended taking all that off and my husbands app.  Well, thanks.  At this point that little gesture is meaningless.   We couldn't get home soon enough...guess what now...that app, the only thing my husband actually ate...came right back up.  We had to pull over 3 times for him to vomit.  Awesome.   Stay away from this place...
Terrible!!!!  Service?????  Took over 45 min for a salad and soup and hamburger!!! The place was NOT full by any means . I will not be back!!!

Try -500 stars! Rude, inconsiderate  and just plain crappy! Went here about 2 weeks ago great service. Today they were so bad we walked out!  If you want horrible service this is your place! Now you know why the place is EMPTY when you go here. Thanks for giving me pnemonia !

Ideally, I love TGIF's.  I really can't complain. The services are great. The food is great. The atmosphere is great (if you like loud, family places). It's so chill, you could take the family, or take your first date. It's not too pricey, but not cheap too.

Its been a while since ive been backt o this place and that was when I was not 21 lol. Now that I am...this place is definitely my favorite only because of their killer happy hour!!  I sat at the bar and I was immediately greeted and had my beer in hand all in 5 minuets. It wasnt busy at all which was great but the people that were here that day was a pretty quiet crowd. Generally when you sit at the bar you expect to have some small conversations with some cool/weird people...who knows! Maybe youll find your next gf here haha. Well when I was there I was being stared at from across the bar by some weird couple, I kept checking my face to see if it was really that ugly but that wasnt the case. So I stared back at them (stare contest began) and I held my ground until my eyes dried out then I looked down at my empty beer lol.  I like the fact that they have two options of cup size, one is 16 and the other is 22oz. I would recommend you take advantage of the 22oz deal since the cost for it is only 2-$3 more!! I cant say much but the fact that the people that do go here is families and older people (50+) but I will update my review next time I come back, but for now 3 stars because it didnt really wow me in any way and plus I was at the bar so I pretty much serviced myself.

**More than we bargained for** We went in on a weeknight looking to get a salad and ended up getting unexpected entertainment because it was karaoke night. Who would've thought Fridays does karaoke during the week? Not me.  There were definitely those who bombed the whole karaoke thing but there were also a few that seemed to be regulars. It was a little unexpected but it was pretty entertaining and funny to watch.  I got the Cobb Salad which basically had the standard cobb salad fixings; bacon, egg, blue cheese, grilled chicken, avocado, cheddar chese, etc but they add olives to theirs which I asked to remove. The cobb salad was pretty good and got no complaints from me.  The hubby got the turkey club with french fries - no complaints there either. We also couldn't resist getting a half order of the potato skins which were yummy as always. Why are those things so darn good and impossible for me to resist?

four of us decided to dine at TGIF but after see there 2 star rating from 200 reviews and read them that was enough for so we did want to chance it; So we all decided to take "High End B' advise and looked up BJ on yelp found what a difference in rating 3 1/2 over 400 reviews along with over 200 photo's to view.....Bottom Line we made the right choice. BJ's Our server was great. The only neg would be 'No' happy hour on Saturday except late evening . Mon Thru Fr; 3 to 7    For such a popular chain as TGIF 2 star no excuse ether get a new Manager or this location will be closing.

We've been a long time Fridays fan.  Unfortunately this Saturday at 4 o'clock and there is 16 people waiting outside.  We are told there is a waiting list 15-20 minutes long yet the restaurant is empty inside.  According to the hostess we cant sit at any tables in the bar because they are for people on the list too.  Many people are walking out. Beware of extreme disorganization.

Brought my family for dinner, they sat us down very quickly and took our orders. The food was good and brought out to us pretty quick. Unfortunately they lack in service. They were staffed well from what I could see but it seems they had couple different servers covering our table so a common thing like checking up on us was forgotten. All I needed was water but was able to requested it when they brought out the bill.

TGI Friday's in general is not really my first choice for food, but my friends and I were ravenous after a rehearsal. We were a party of six. We were greeted by some very young hosts that were gossiping at the host stand and barely paying attention to the guests. Upon being seated and served, the service was incredibly slow and inattentive, the whole ordeal took over two hours. Being from the service industry I always leave a tip, but I genuinely could not tip because we had such a terrible experience.  Then again, I should have known to not go there. The first time I sat at the bar and our bartender was clearly intoxicated and the manager thought it was hilarious.  It's just terrible. Don't go there. Just drive the extra 3 miles to get somewhere else.

Absolute worst experience! Last Saturday I go for a bike ride and afterwards I was feeling a bit hungry so made plans and girl and I head out to TGI Fridays. Have been to the place once or twice before (that location) but not had food as I was meeting friends for drinks before. Upon arriving we get greeted and give them our name for seating. As usual I prefer seating in a booth so we wait for our booth and once they are ready we walk through the bar to go grab our booth. We get dragged to the last booth right before getting to the kitchen and we are asked if that's fine; having  just passed a booth that wasn't as close to the kitchen we choose that one and step back to it and sit. We get seated and menus on the table. A couple of minutes go by and the server comes and takes our drink order, asks if we are ready for our food order, we weren't, and goes and gets our drinks. Could notice this server was in training but no big deal, you expect the same service anyway. We get our drinks and we order our food, they have a 2 for $20 deal so we order though that: - Cheeseburger (medium rare) with sweet potato fries, no onions (upcharge of $1.79 for sweet potatoes without being told about it) - Chicken pasta - Spinach Florentine Flatbread Server advises us we get another appetizer through this promo so we order the second appetizer, Mozzarella sticks. After we order we wait for our food now. I had ordered a diet coke with no ice, and I received my diet coke with ice...no surprise there. The beverage was also not sufficiently carbonated which I assume it's a matter of bad/old equipment. The restaurant is in an old building so it makes sense. After a few minutes I see the server come by and notices there's nothing on the table yet, does not say anything just walks back. Forgot to put the order in? Yup! We get the appetizers in two rounds, first the mozzarella sticks and later the flatbread. I assume we got the mozzarella sticks first as they take less time to prepare. A few minutes later we receive the flatbread which in my taste didn't cook properly, it was not crispy as expected, but the taste was ok. Entree time and our food arrives, a smallish burger that came frozen no doubt and the pasta with chicken that was actually tasty. The burger sat in the food warmers for a while, the lettuce was starting to cook (black color) and was warm to the touch. The burger was cooked well and the fries were a pittance! I did not complain at all as I imagined it was ordered as part of a "value menu" as well as not knowing about the upcharge on the fries. Everything went well, during dinner, food was not worth writing home about but it was within expectations. Nothing to report during dinner other than my cup of diet coke kept getting more ice with every refill. But then came the check... The check came to be much higher than I expected to begin with and that's when I started getting annoyed... Take 1: Call the server (trainer) who gave us the check and told him about the mistake, every entree and appetizer was put on as a "regular" not as a "Promo." He promptly takes the check and comes back about 10 minutes later with the revised check. Take 2: The revised check comes but charges for the second appetizer...I call the server (trainer) again and he explains that only one appetizer is included. I replied that only one appetizer was ordered until we were told that another appetizer was included. Goes back and another 10 minutes go by for the revised check. Finally get the last check with a comped appetizer (regardless at $7.99 for the mozzarella sticks, it's highway robbery!) and I square it off! Got to thinking after I left the restaurant that there were no potatoes in my plate but...too late. The server was in training but that should not have made a difference. At that point we check the yelp reviews and...no wonder! In short: Value in food was bad. Quality of service was bad, ambiance was also mediocre (kept hearing the kitchen all night). Will I go to that restaurant ever again...maybe if it is the last place that hasn't been raided after an apocalypse!

This is a hard rating for me to decide on as parts of the meal were awesome but other aspects left much to be desired. My boyfriend and I visited T.G.I. Friday's last week around 8:30 on a weeknight so the restaurant wasn't busy by any means. I say this because we can't figure out how they managed to mis-time our meals by so much that my boyfriend's food was cold when it arrived at the table. It was so cold that he had to return it to the kitchen, which left me to eat my meal alone before it got cold too. My food was very good though. I ordered the 10 oz. sirloin and had mashed potatoes and french fries (what can I say? I'm a potato-lovin girl!) on the side. Once my boyfriend's food arrived hot, it was tasty too. He got the shrimp and salmon combo. We had a buy one get one coupon from the email mailing list and that's one thing that saved the night. Got to love great deals like that, right?
Had not been here in years since they revised their menu and eliminated their French Onion soup and deep fried mushrooms Came in for happy hour and apps. Everything was great

Sometimes, you just want to go some where chill, have a beer and watch the game.  Fridays is a good spot. Great happy hour specials for food and drink after 10 and open until 2am which is rare in north county.   The bartenders rock and I always get good service.    The cajun chicken pasta is amazing, definately my fav.

I have been eating at TGIF's all over this great nation of our's and this location is so far from being called a restaurant. First waiting to be seated we saw 4 staff members pass us by 15 mins later the host showed up and took us to our seat. I wonder if it is TGIFs. Practice to have staff members not acknowledge guests coming to eat . Ok second we ordered drinks simple or so you would think.  "2 cokes. Child's chocolate milk and a large milk in a chilled pint glass". Cokes came with straws,child's  Chocolate milk no straw and chilled pint had been replaces with a small cup of milk.  Ok so let me guess  you have no chilled pints? Nope. It's against company policy to serve non alcoholic drinks in chilled pints. WTF!!!!! I hope the bartender is smart enough to realise O'Doul's  is a non alcoholic beer !!! Ok. I know this is getting long. But I have to finish to make sure this place does not feed another soul for fear the zombie's will be born and Armageddon shall commence !!!  The staff not so good. The drinks even worse. The food to put it lightly. I would not feed a rabid dog that tasteless food for fear I may kill a rabid dog ! Go some place else to spend your hard earned money and burn this place to the ground and start over . Maybe a TGIF  would build a restaurant here !

Went on a Sunday night with my bf.  Now,  I've been to this location several times before and it's always a mediocre experience (I can think of one time where the server + the food was spectacular). But this time was pretty bad.  Got there, guy tells us sit anywhere in bar area.  So we sit down and few mins later this other hostess girl makes a snide comment about this table isn't open seating but she'll let it slide.  Then walks away. Excuse me? !! The waiter takes about 15mins to get our drink order.  Another 10 for him to bring them out, my margarita was disgusting btw,  they did however bring out the appetizers fairly quickly.  That was last time we saw our server,  I swear the bartender was more concerned about us than the waiter.  We had to him for waters in beginning since our server was mia.  Tgif really need to get their stuff together. ..

It's TGI Friday's Yelpers what do you want me to say here... On my last visit (for a few beers w/co-workers) included TGI's warm pretzel breadsticks with cheese beer dip.  When the heck did these ninja sticks get added to the menu?  It's like a all the goodness of a warm hot pretzel in convenient "bread stick form" covered in butter garlic salt crack? It came with a cheese dip but I'm a traditionalist "just butter garlic salt crack" for me PLEASE...PLEASE I NEED MORE!!!! You need a break from potato skins?  Actually...those are really hella good too - anyway get these AMAZING pretzels as well!   I give this much needed happy hour 7 "I'll just have ONE plus several more" out of 10.

This place is the worst TGIF that we ever been too. I guess they don't care since they get  alot of tourist from Legoland or the Outlet. We went here after Legoland and the wait was horrible the manager sits a large party before sitting when clearly my party was there. I had not been to a T.G.I Friday's in a long time.  My last experience with this chain had been pretty bad and ended with the manager taking a chicken breast out of our to-go box with his bare hands.  I think I've been back maybe once since that incident. Back in late December, we were coming back from a San Diego Chargers game and took a exit where we thought there would be some casual sit-down places.  There was not much around except for this Friday's.  Friday's would not be our first choice, but we wanted to just eat and get going. This Friday's was a little different (at least from the outside).  It was attached to a Days Inn.  Not a standard Days Inn either.  It had a house-like structure at the front entrance--almost like a bed and breakfast.  The decor was your standard Friday's. We ordered a half order of potato skins, which was a decent portion size.  The potato skins were topped with cheese and bacon.  Sour cream on the side.  The potato skins were nicely crisp and not too greasy.  The portion of cheese and bacon was what you would expect at a Friday's.  Some skins were evenly topped while some skins were only half covered with cheese. Most of us had the Jack Daniel's flat iron steak, and it was surprisingly good.  The steak was a good cut of meat.  It was tender and flavorful and cooked a perfect medium rare.  The Jack Daniel's thin sauce on the side was nicely sweet.  The loaded mashed potatoes came stuffed with cheddar cheese, green onions and bacon.  The mashed potatoes were okay.  The menu announced the calorie count on most of the dishes to tell you what kind of trouble you were getting yourself into.  There was also a portion of steamed broccoli that (while nothing special) at least added some vegetables and something green to the plate. Service was quick enough and dining there was comfortable.  Near the exit, there was a bell with a rope attached to it that you are supposed to ring if you had a good time.  Many were ringing it.  I gave it a ring too.  For what it was, this Friday's was not that bad and better than what I expected. Parking was free and spaces were easy to find.
