Its too bad because we thoroughly enjoyed other Fridays locations in the past.  Contact me if this place ever gets better. The menu has so much potential, but the delivery is severely flawed.

I loved TGI Fridays in OC. I want to love it sooo bad here. My only gripe is that they should really man the tables more and make sure they are clean. I understand that its not so busy here, but that should be more reason to keep things peachy keen! Other than that the food is good and i really like their happy hour deals and yummmerz on the mixed drinks..!

OH MY was this place TERRIBLE!!!  I've been here a few times trying to give them the benefit of the doubt that it was "x, y, or z" that made it terrible. I give up...they're just terrible.  So this last trip there was 6 in our party, it was a Saturday night at 10pm and the place was all but dead. 1. The waitress spilled water all over me and didn't apologize or offer to get me a napkin--she did however clean up the table.  2. They were out of not 1, not 2 but 3 things that I tried to order 3. The drink I wanted to order had to be purchased WITH a souvenir glass. I didn't want the glass--just the drink. Apparently they can't do that.  4. It took more than 1 hour to get our food after ordering it...REALLY?!? ...for 6 people at 10pm when the place had 3 other people in it? 5. 4 of their staff were outside on patio smoking almost the entire time we were there...no wonder our food took so long--no one works there.  6. They served everyone their dinner except one person because "it wasn't ready yet"....who serves a meal to guests separately? Ramsey would be pissed! By the time we were done eating, the last meal came out of the kitchen.  7. The waitress kept forgetting our orders and had to ask multiple times what we ordered.  8. I'm pretty sure the waitress was stoned...I'm not against that IF she could do her job while stoned because in that event its none of my business...but DANG lady you spilled water on me, forgot our orders, forgot that there was food to be served an hour later, and then forgot to bring us our check after we asked for it twice. Lay off the refer!  Overall it was pretty unbelievable.  I guess the food was so-so ...pretty typical for a chain so thats the 1 star...otherwise they'd have zero.

First of all we we're kind of conned into going to this place by the "buy one get one free" coupons we got from the place we were staying. From the moment we walked in we found out why. This place looked like it was last remodeled in 1992 when the place first opened. It looked very outdated.  Our server only came around periodically and on several occasions we had to flag her down to get some service and this was before the dinner crowd showed up. For being a night of Monday Night Football, the crowd did not seem any larger than a typical week night crowd, yet the staff seemed unprepared. The only reason I'm giving this 1 star was the food was at least decent. We've been to several TGI Fridays before and have enjoyed the food and service but this one is clearly below the mark. You don't have to be an expert restaurant critic to know this place just isn't up to par!

Today we went with friends and I ordered for my mom and I.   We ordered a Turkey Burger and a balsamic glazed chicken Ceser salad.   The salad had a very little drizzle of balsamic glaze on the very dry chicken which was laid on top of a very dry salad.  It sucked.  The Turkey Burger was apparently out of box from the freezer because that is what it tasted like.  All the burgers ( i found out) come dry with nothing on them which is fine but then dont drop off the friggen burger without asking me what I might want you to bring to put on it.  I dont want to wait till you come back around to tell you to bring something.   I told her we were splitting our orders and she offered no extra plates, gave my mom no silverware, etc etc etc..  The waitresses were very nice but they need to know better customer service.   TGIF does not have quality food.   The only thing I can say positive about the experience is my car was parked close to the exit.     In the past I have had cocktails here.  I would suggest keeping it limited to that.

The employees were very pleasant but the food was awful. I've been to many a TGI Fridays so I was pretty surprised. Came here last Friday and we got some garlic shrimp dish and a salmon/steak dish. The garlic dish was AWFUL. It was super greasy and was 90% cheese. Oh and we also found 2 or 3 whole cloves of garlic. It takes minimal effort to chop up a piece of garlic. The salmon/steak dish was waaaayyyy overcooked. Unless every restaurant is closed down in Carlsbad...I doubt I'll go back.

Terrible! The waitress didn't know the menu. The manager was argumentative the food was cold. I had to go to the dang bar to get my food HOT. The bartender should be working bar not picking up the slack for serving staff that is incompetent. Stay away! Go to BJ's down the street. Muuuuch better.  I have given one star only because I can't give none. Horrible restaurant. And it's a shame that it is too because it's the only Fridays in the area.

ooooooh weeeeee! never again!! me and my boyfriend's chicken was over cooked so it was extra dry! our waiter was as enthusiastic as eyore from winnie the pooh. i honestly had a bad feeling about this place. i thought i was on an episode of bar rescue!! they definitely need mr. taffey's help!

Came here with my friends after work, the server was a bit confused on taking our order, maybe it was her lack of training, and all the food came out at different times and tasted flavorless and dry. Disappointed. Maybe cause its not Friday?
Terrible service. We came yesterday. All of our food was over cooked and uneatable. Never coming back here.

Not only a low quality restaurant, because it is a tgif.... but also long waits because it is on a hotel property. To make matters worse, low quality staff. Sitting and waiting for a table I am watching the GROUP of host&hostesses talk about disrespectful topics regarding the customers. Insulting them when they walk away. What horrible people!!! Hey t.g.i. Fridays,  get new staff!!!! Ugh!!
It was just alright, nothing special.  When I went to sit down good thing I looked cause my seat was covered in water!  The parking lot sucks, the food was good for dinner and margaritas! :)

One of the worst experiences I've ever had....First off, the place had only about 15 customers but still yet we had to wait 25 minutes for a table for 3, after that they got my meal wrong twice and the chicken was extremely dry. The waiter didn't bring us silverware so my son had to flag down someone else to bring us some. The only good thing about it was that the manager was very nice and respectful....Never eating at this place again.

I love their happy hour! Have been here many many times, experienced a few slow, not very good servers, but overall ive had only good experiences! Check in on foursquare too.. ive gotten a free appetizer and working on my free dessert :)
It's a Friday's, no different than any other. It's not where I go for a gourmet meal or specialty drinks, but that Jack Daniel's sampler ALWAYS hits the spot!

Party of 14 We called and gave them a heads up we were coming on a Saturday night. They had our table ready and our waiter was immediately present once we all sat down. Service, food, and staff were great! No complaints here!!! Will come back again when we are in town. Kudos to a job well done!
Whent on a trip to legoland and for dinner we stooped at tgif. . food was disgusting. .mashed potatoes tasted like corkboard box., ,i do nit recommend. .
Everything was terrible. Service was terrible. Food was cold. Asked for the tv to be changed twice and never was. The server couldn't keep track of our checks. Just overall terrible.

My experiences here have not been good! I went in last week, and found a huge change. The hostess was kind and informative. Our server Jessie, was AMAZING! We loved that she was conservative in a room full of hookers! Lol i had to ask if fridays was leaning towards 'sex sells' as every girl there had a butt cheek hanging out. We are picky eaters, and have lots of allergen questions. The restaurant was busy and she took her time explaining things we wanted to know. She was efficient, got things before we asked, and checked on us regularly without pestering us. She was friendly, funny, and all around an amazing waitress.  The food was as good as ever, however, was very slow!! The kitchen messed up my sons order and it had to be sent back. Jessie and her manager (pablo I think) were very apologetic and fixed our order right away! The long islands were amazing as always! Thanks Fridays for turning my opinion around!!! Keep up the good work!

Typical TGIF food, quiet location with great service.  We did the $2 for $10.  The Spinach Florentine Flatbread appetizer was nice, just enough toppings and the crust was crunchy (but not burnt).  We upgraded to the Flat Iron steaks which were cooked perfectly and tasted great.  Baked potato and broccoli were OK.  Our waitress was very nice.

UGH! Worst Fridays ever! The waiter was rude and rolled his eyes at us 4 times. He wouldn't substitute rye bread for something else on the ruben sandwich,  He said they only had rye bread in the restaurant and no other bread. He brought all of our plates out 5 mins. apart from the next person. and worst of all my hamburger bun had MOLD on it!!!! they wouldn't take the charge off the bill for it either. This place sucks. The service sucks, the food sucks. Don't go there.

If you are looking for the chain restaurant that started it all, then you came to the right place.  They are starting to become fewer and farther between, so it is always nice to find one to eat at when the mood strikes you. Classically designed inside, this TGI Fridays serves up familiar favorites with some great specials, such as $10 and 2 for $20 specials. But the real star here is the Jack Daniels sauce.  Order anything on the menu slathered with this stuff and you can't go wrong.

Horrible service! Took us a long time to just get some water. Then when they finally brought our beers they didn't have coasters.  Time to order and our waitress took forever, we came in for 10$ appetizer and entree deal they have.  It was strange that they didn't have that on their regular menu, the waitress handed us a scrunched up paper from her pocket. Apparently they don't promote the 10$ deal unless YOU ask FOR IT which I thought was ridiculous.  She didn't even know what were talking about I had to ask her twice. Took us a while to pick our. Food the appetizers came out first mozzarella sticks and potato skins which surprisingly were good and hot.  Couldn't finish them.  For my entree I ordered the cheesey chicken with mashed potatoes, while the boyfriend got the steak,  veggies and mashed potatoes. The service was awful BUT the food was actually good.  I didn't tip the waitress and didn't feel bad because honestly service really lacked.

I read some reviews that don't compliment the food, but I actually really loved the food here. The ambiance was cozy , the staff was friendly and the food tasted really good! The portions were rather large so it's a good value for the price. The overall experience was satisfying and I would definitely go there again. The highlight was getting a flower on our way out in appreciation- so sweet!
Brad was a great Waiter! Quick,Fast,and awesome!

I ate here last month with my family for a birthday, and let me say that the food was good, but the staff was great. Everyone was very friendly and kind, and helped a lot. The food was just like what you would expect at any regular restaurant, but the staff made it stand out. I would definitely recommend it.

I came here with a friend when they were running their whatever deal when you get blah, blah and blah blah for like 9.99 or whatever.  we came here and got our food. meh, whatever. I can cook better myself than these guys. the server here was really uninterested in me and my friend and took forever to refill our drinks and when we were finished and ready for the dessert part of meal, I think we had lost all interest in the restaurant itself.  the dessert that we got was the oreo cheesecake thing, and wow, let me just say, this was the most disgusting that I have ever put into my mouth. I think I must have only taken one a half bites of this and then just pushed it away. the cheesecake left this weird crazy slimy feeling/texture in my mouth.  I would totally recommend going to Applebee's or Chili's than coming to this place.

TGI Fridays is a super fun place to go hang out on Sunday and Tuesday nights since they have Karaoke in the bar starting at 8pm.  There is a nice atmosphere and the bar tenders are waaay cool! You can't beat the variety of awesome food on their menu - and they have some pretty amazing Happy Hour specials - i.e. $2 Tacos and $5 shots of Patron on Tuesday nights!  Also - their appetizers are all half off on Sundays. Nice place to meet up with friends!
the food was okay. but the service sucked. we waited forever for our food and not many people were there. definitely will not be going back

I am very very disappointed with TGI FRIDAYS. It was my first attempt to every dine with them and of course i was excited to see what food and service they have to offer. I was with a friend that night. and let me tell you it was a WEEKDAY. So we went in and was asked to wait for 20 mins.. we were thinking it was busy so OK we waited just like everyone else. So after 20 mins we have been called to get seated and as we waled into their dining floor i was surprised how SLOW they were for them to have everyone wait AT LEAST 20 MINS. Ok whatever i didnt voice myself out yet. So this lady sat usdown the last booth which smelled gross as fuck.. she handed us the Menus and said that our server will be there in a few minutes. Ok so me and my friend browsed through the menu to see whats good.. we talked and browsed through the menu again. WAITING FOR OUR SEVRER.. next thing you know all we did was browse through the damn menu.. and i timed it and was about 40 min and YET NOBODY NOT A SINGLE DAMN EMPLOYEE OFFERED US A BEVERAGE.. OH WOW! HOW BUSY THEY WERE RIGHT? WE WALKED OUT OF THAT PLACE AND WILL NEVER COME BACK.

I kept seeing all the TGIF commercials on TV and just had to give them a try. What a disappointment! The Carlsbad TGI Fridays is dark and outdated. Service was sub par as was the food. Can't honestly suggest trying this place - ever!
The food was just okay, the hostess was rude and the waitress was over worked.  I won't be going back.

This is, hands down, the best TGI Fridays out of the many I have been to across the country. Granted living in Mission Valley, it's not a crazy drive up to Carlsbad, it is out of the way. There's a TGIF literally 5 minutes from our house, but, I firmly believe, they are the 'special' location. They suck beyond sucking...if you want to pay to be disrespected as a paying customer, go there. Anyways, back to the Carlsbad location, we go up there any time we want some good food and EXCELLENT service. And you should too!

We have been coming here for over a year and have nothing but great service and food every time that we visit. We went here last night for my son's birthday and they were so nice and made him feel special (he turned 7).....even had one of the servers come by surprise my son with a couple dollars that was folded to look like a shirt. We have always had great food and great service! No complaints!

SALUTE TO ANDERSEN'S PEA SOUP. R.I.P. This chain tries hard to offer non-generic as well as generic dishes with some healthy choices. Of course all the fried stuff is most likely what sells the best. But the worst thing about this location is that it used to be Andersen's which sold the best damn pea soup on the planet. People used to drive out of the way into Carlsbad just for the soup. You could spot it mile away as the location sports a giant windmill.  This review is really a homage to Andersen's which was once a Carlsbad landmark. Why did this city allow this to happen? Shame on you for allowing a TGI Fridays to move on it. It's been about six years and I'm still not over it.

This location sucks!!!! I've given this one 3 chances and EACH ONE WAS WORST THEN THE PREVIOUS!!! The service Is poor; food takes WAAAY too long and every waiter never checks back if we need anything. I WILL NEVER COME HERE AGAIN. They really need to step it up. So surprised they are still open. Take my advice...go eat somewhere else...you'll thank me.

:-| I haven't been to one of these places since College..  (and that was yuuuuuurrrrrrrrrs ago.) They've got online deals going so check out their site for free coupons. My friend at work is crazy about trying new places and can print out coupons faster than you can say:  "FOK ME I'M HUNGRY!" BAM!   Free appetizer. BAM!   Free meal with purchase of meal. BAM!   Kids eat free TUESDAY! BAM!   More BACON! BAM!   ALL YOU CAN EAT! BAM!   FREE SOFT DRINKS! I'm surprised how so much has changed, and yet NOT. Check out their actual menu. You will shit a greasy ALLI shit when you find out how many MORE calories are in the chicken sandwiches, or the salads, than the bacon double cheeseburger! I ordered the BBLT with onion rings.. twice the bacon --TASTY. And we used our coupon for a FREE appetizer...  (whispers)  Order the cheese sliders... three mini burgers small in size, big on taste. I was impressed. 2 people stuffed themselves for $15. But OMG.. who the FOK hangs out at this particular TGI FRIDAYS? (Apparently all the stoner chicks from my high school days.) TRAIL-OR-PARK. Regardless, the meals were tasty, and you can keep track of your calorie intake all at the same time! The service was friendly and fast.... and as always there's lots to gawk at... I mean LOOK at. Just don't feed the beasts. 3 WOOFS.. A-OK..... PRINT ME OUT ANOTHER COUPON!  "FOK ME I'M HUNGRY!"
Augh.  Gross.  The floor under our table was wet with god knows what.  The food tasted pre-made, the cocktails were all sickly sweet.  Blehn.
Food was what you would expect, but the service is awful!!!!  They got our order wrong, disappeared numerous times and never cleared a single plate.

I've never had TGI Friday before, that is until last week. The employees were nice, but the service was slow. The table next to us got their appetizer before us and we came 10 minutes before them! The food wasn't all that satisfying either, my stomach still felt empty! The only good thing is, they have good steak.
Our waitress was great! But, I have been here on the weekends, when service is slow. I had the 1/2 rack of ribs and lobster- it was great!
Service was slow. Could have walked over to the am/pm quicker to my drink.  Paper towel dispensers in the head were broken.

Food is not that great here and service is TERRIBLE!! Waitress does not smile or greet you at all, they all look like they hate working there!!! Not once did anyone come ask how the food was or anything.  Never coming here again!

Now I love TGI Fridays all around. I have been to many and never really had a problem. This place has a problem. So we get there and there's a wait (no biggie) then we get seated. We wait...then get our drink order in....wait ten more minutes...then we get our order in. By now the restaurant is semi empty and we have been waiting 30 minutes for our food. We get the food. My friend ordered her pkate with fries not mashed potatoes and what do you know...mashed potatoes. And my plate looks awesome but the top layer is cold and the cheese has formed a hard layer. My other friend ordered just a slice of red velvet cake which wasn't brought to her until the foodrunner asked if she ordered anything...wtf? So she then gets her cake which is awful. I love TGI's red velvet cake and this tastes like when I decide to bake a cake. It was crumbly and hard with almost no taste. And then we realize we have no utensils! And our waiter is still no where to be seen! We flag down another waitress and she hands us our silverware. We continue to eat in disappointed silence and pay the bill after finishing our food and waiting ten minutes for our waiter to give us the check. Bad experience, will never go back and they need to work on their customer service.

This TGI Fridays location has gone completely down hill. They were out of a majority of the items we attempted to order on the menu..bartender ignored us the entire night. Will not be back until it returns to the great restaurant it used to be....
Food was average. Slow service and waiter forgot items requested and substitutions.
Went here on my lunch break... Waiter kept rushing me to order, spinach dip was cold, but my other food was good... I've had better...wouldnt go here again except to drink

The only reason I come here is for the Jack Daniels steak...Jack Daniels anything really. That signature sauce is DELICIOUS. Oh ya, and the mashed potatoes here are pretty dank.  The service is Aiight-at best.  If you've never tried the Jack Daniels steak, I highly recommend it, its GUDE

This is the only  TGI Friday's I've been to So far, I've always gotten very friendly service at this location. The hostesses are okay, but I've gotten nothing but friendly faces from servers. One of the things I love about this TGI Friday's is that they have that delicious Jack Daniels menu.  My wife loves the drinks here, I just order coke or Dr. Pepper. They don't have the best food in the world but I think it is a place I can come to to get some food that is YUMMY.  T.G.I Fridays is pretty good stuff. I normally order the burgers, I am a burger guy by the way.  Try this place at least once.

So we had a coupon for buy one get one. We ordered a Jack Daniels flat iron steak and steak fajitas. Without the coupon the bill would have been $35 for both plus two sodas. Luckily the coupon brought it down to $22 and change. Considering the size of the flat iron, it was overpriced. The fajitas had enough food that I was stuffed by the time my stomach settled on the drive home. But my dad was still hungry and he opted to eat dessert at home since the one he wanted at the restaurant was over 1400 calories. He enjoyed the steak and thought it was very good but there were few french fries on the plate and the baked beans we very soupy and too sweet. The steak for fajitas was tender and very good but the onion/pepper combo was overly greasy (my guess the majority of the 1600+ calories in the meal) and the beans, once again, soupy. The rice looked misplaced for tex-mex food seeing as it was yellow (my guess saffron) and looked more like rice you'd eat at a Persian restaurant. There could have been more cheese on the sides plate but it wasn't a big deal. Overall, it was tasty and I did finish it but for $15 it was a bit underwhelming. Can't expect much more from a chain trying to appeal to vast demographics throughout the country (which is why I think the baked beans were more suited to the palate of Southerners). The service was pretty fast but our waitress seemed frazzled, almost like they were understaffed for servers. We probably won't eat there unless we have another BOGO just because it has gotten so expensive and there are plenty of mom and pop places that cost the same without a coupon and more food to take home. The quality was eh, something I expected from a chain restaurant. Major props to our server who did the best she could and was very nice. It's nice that Friday's puts the calorie count on each item but it would be nice for fat and sodium numbers. Granted I hadn't eaten all day so splurging a lot for dinner wasn't a big deal.

The girls at the door must be hurting for money. I know times are hard, but stop stealing my change, hahaha.  About a year ago after purchasing lunch, the girl at the door took my credit card and tipped herself. Today I went back after a year, and this girl grabs my change from the bartender (who is probably the only one trusted with the register), she hands me 15 cents and pockets 2 quarters.  When you eat here make sure you toss the girl at the door some change, or she'll just take it herself.

I will never come here again.  The food at any TGIF restaurant is about the same, so that is not an issue, but I came here for lunch with some coworkers, and we had a horrible experience. We were there for well over two hours, which is unacceptable during a weekday lunch hour, and it took 30 minutes before they even asked us what we wanted. We kept having to ask for service, and my friend Mia said her shrimp pasta tasted like barf.  I will say to their credit, however, that they gave us our food free (and charged us for our drinks), but only after our large bald-headed friend complained to the manager and mentioned calling their corporate office.
Ick.  Party of 5.  No one's food was very good.  Feels old and not well taken care of.  Not coming back.

My hubby and I went there on Saturday @9pm. Food was good. Service not so good. We waited about 10 min before anyone asked us for our drink order nor did we get asked if we wanted refills. Music playing was bad. No alternating or a variety of music it sounded like heavy metal. The greeters were young teenagers.  They were not professional. Checking cell phone frequently.  Playing patty cake games, jumping to touch the top of door. Just childish. Definitely do not recommended to others and we will not go back here.

I hate to do this review, but it needs to be done. I had made reservations for 12 for my husbands surprise b-day party.  Everyone got there before my husband and I.  I checked in and told them I had reservations for a surprise party (which I told them on the phone) the host pointed me to the back and said everyone is back there.  I had to whisper to her and ask her if she can seat us because my husband doesn't know.  So she did. I knew this was the beginning of a horrible night with bad service, and I was right.  Food was forgotten and never brought out, drinks were not filled.  My nephew is 3 and he never got his food,.  We asked for it and it finally came out while we were eating desert... after we had canceled the order with the waitress.  The server didn't know it was my husband's birthday so I had to ask them to sing happy birthday to him.  All of this was discussed when I made reservations.   We had the bill split up from the beginning and when we got the bill there were items that were on the wrong ticket.  I then gave the waitress my rewards number so I can get the points put onto my card.  I checked my rewards a few days later and the points were never added.  At the end of our visit I complained to the manager.  He was very apologetic and said the waitress is in college.  I'm a mother, I work full time and I go to school.  This is not an excuse to give horrible customer service at work.  I didn't buy that excuse.  So the manager gave us a discount.. which I already had a coupon for a discount, and gave me some coupons to come back. I called a few days later after I noticed I didn't get my rewards.  I got the run around and the manager Paublo never called me back.  I gave up.  T.G.I Fridays has lost my business.   My husbands birthday was a disaster and he did not have as great of a time as he would have liked with his family there.  I was so embarrassed in front of his family since I am the one that planned this surprise party. I am disappointed with our experience there.  I feel I should have been called back right away and given my rewards. I eventually got over it since I never want to go back again.

Well this makes two bad experiences at a TGIF. I came here with a group of girls after BJ's was too crowded....quickly a bubbly woman from the bar came to take care of us. After she went to get us waters to start a man came over and we said we've already been helped. he awkwardly said this is my section i will go see whats up. well the woman gave us away to him and everything went downhill. The service was awful. He was awkward the entire time.This was a Saturday night but the place was not busy so that could not be their excuse for slow service.  we had appetizers of queso and spinach dip we ran out of chips and we had to ask twice before more were brought out for us and by the time they were brought out our dips were cold. They messed up my sisters drink order and took several minutes to bring out the right drink. the food finally came out and it was just MEH. Thank god we didn't have enough in our group for gratuity because the waiter didn't deserve it. I hope to not return.

DO NOT eat here.  The food's average, the price is high for what you get and the service is the slowest on earth.  I thought they went into the flower fields next door looking for a cow to grind into a burger it took so long.  Not only did it take 20 minutes to get a drink of soda, the waiter continuosly appologized for how slow it was....but the place was freakin empty!!!!  I guess everyone but me knows this place sucks.  It took almost two hours to feed 4 of us on very simple basic menu items. Try the Tip Top meats restaurant near by.  Great food, low prices and big portions.

I am giving this place 3 stars based upon their late night happy hour and cheap drinks. Otherwise the place sucks.  If your looking for deep fried bar food and cheap drinks after 10pm, this is the place to go. Otherwise go elsewhere for a decent meal.

This is one of my go-to lunch places. Oh well, the proximity is what draws me to this place. I dont want to go thru the menu, you've probably been to a TGIF. Ample parking, prompt seating and (mostly) friendly staff. I've been here by myself and sometimes with a coworker. One thing I noticed was that I was always seated at the rear end of the restaurant. I wonder why. Maybe I always endup with the same waiter who tends to that part of the restaurant. I dont care, its a nice area, with less noise. Its just something on my mind. Also, there was one waiter who didnt particularly appeal to me. No smile, no thank you, hmm. It still is a nice place for a few drinks and grub.

This restaurant was Fun! I had a good time tonight after a long day. Food was awesome and killer deal on hard lemonaid from the bar. I had good service everyone made sure I was Taken care of. Busser Steven had a Nice smile and personality! I Deffinatly will come back again.

Went to this place last night. Horrible service. We had a party of 16. They told us 15 min to be sat. 20 minutes later they told us they are setting up tables. 20 minutes after that they told us 15 more minutes. Didn't get sat for over an hour....they weren't even that busy. Then most of our parties orders were either wrong, over/under cooked and poor quality for the hellacious price they charge. Don't go....not to this one.

So I came on here as a big group, around 14 people. It was sunday at 4 PM and my party was seated fairly quickly as we had a reservation, My server was Lilly. Now look i know that gratuity is included in a large group so you already make money but most people add tips on top of that if the service is good. Which it was not. LIlly constantly disappeared and was very inattentive and slow to do refills or anything, even bringing the check. The service here is horrid and it just angered me. I asked her for a refill for my strawberry lemonaide(which btw they charge for refills) and it took her 15 minutes to bring it to me. WTF?!?!?! At the end of the meal she forgot to add gratuity and i FORGOT TO TIP HER. And as far as the food is concerned, it was average at best. Worse than Chilis or Applebees.

The food was aweful and the service was worse! We're pretty laid back diners but this review was warranted. It took FOREVER to get our drinks, food and get out and the tab was high. We're out-of-towners so we definitely will not go back but I hope this helps potential customers make an informed decision.

Ive been to Fridays many many times. I just felt that this server was worth the review. Its almost always the same story with them, kitchen working a little slow but it gives  you more times for drinks. Sean my server was great, kept the mood up and kept us interested and refreshed, so refreshed my girl had to drive me home but refreshed never the less. The food was still good and although i know you can get faster service other places on a saturday night having someone making to mood good and keeping it fun is more important to me. Kudos to him and ill definetly be back.
Pretty good service except some of the server girls are a little under dressed. Food was alright.
Food is typical for this venue; however, both times I've been here the service was slow and poor. The facilities could be cleaner too. Its only a place to go if you don't want to go elsewhere.

Great service and a great place for any occasion. I've been here many times and its a hard place to beat for any occasion. I watch my charger games here "when i'm not working or when the games arn't blacked out" or even come during luch for happy hour. The staff is friendly and I was seated quickly. Even doing phone orders, the food is done by the time they say it will be and you can be in and out in a minute. Although its a great place for groups I did notice that twicw when I was in a group we had a problem with the bill. If you don't tell them to put it on a seperate bills early then you may have a problem but other than that I highly recomend this place for any occasion. Espically wathcing the Chargers whoop the raiders (I capitalized Chargers and not raidars for a reason)
Super slowwwwwww service. That is a big negative for me. The food was not too bad.

This place is horrid. Not only is their service unnaturally slow and horrid, but their food is clearly out of a bag and straight out of the microwave. The only thing this place has going for them is their drinks and adult shakes.
What can I say about TGIF.  It's ok... food is decent and price is decent.  Not too bad but not too good.

I use to enjoy going to TGIF when I was younger, now I feel let down.  I'm not sure if my taste buds changed or the food quality went down.  The fries were to salty and our order was incorrect.  I believe this TGIF is understaffed.  Can't blame them, the economy is doing this to all the restaurants.  The food was average but the waiter we had was very upbeat and energetic.  Good customer service even when our order was incorrect.  Waiting for our food took a long time.

Please don't come here waste your time and money. Number one their food is microwaved. Number two their serves are slow. Number three the serves can't do the math, they would give you a wrong bill to pay. Please don't go!

Awful experience I went with my wife to enjoy our Friday night at Fridays. Needless to say service was very slow. spinach dip was cold chips were cold. Dip taste like it was out of a microwaveable plastic bag. Our server was Jessica she was helpful when you track her down. we really believe she was overwhelmed or just interested in other parties.. I don't know if it's only Fridays but I never ordered something and the server never bring any item out to our table. We had the flat iron stake and a chipotle chicken salad, the chicken was gross and cole slaw taste like pico de gallo.  The bathroom smells really bad on the other side of the room..... The manager never introduced himself as a manager.  the server could not get our order correct when it was time to check out. Needless to say not a pleasant experience.

Food was good but the service was horrible.  We had a waitress who literally took twenty minutes to bring me a glass of water, someone else brought it by and she returned twenty minutes later,  we were about to walk out.  She never checked on us during our meal and the table next to us was also upset at her  service.  If you go in, skip on the short female waitress.

We've come to this location twice in the last month because we received a gift card. Both times we had a bad experience. The first time the server took about 20 minutes to realize we were there, finally the manager came by and took our drink order. After a long wait we ordered and waited an even longer time to receive our meals. My meal was wrong so I had to send it back. My fiance was basically done with his meal by the time mine came. The manager gave me my meal for free and was very apologetic.  Our second visit, today for dinner, went at the same slow pace. We were seated right away, typical for a Monday night, but our waiter was very slow in taking down our drink order. There were three other parties seated around us, two of the parties had to flag someone down to ask for a server. I overheard the server two of the parties they were out of something, and we were told as well they were out of an appetizer. Luckily we were in no hurry for both occasions so the slow service wasn't too big of an inconvenience to us. What topped our disappointing visit was that we gave our waiter our gift card and enough cash to cover the rest of the bill that we owed. He took about 10 minutes to run our gift card and process our payment, so we thought he was doing. He handed us the bill back along with the gift card and cash and thanked us for coming. Not sure if he got us confused with another table, or didn't even run the card. This server should be thankful that my fiance and I are honest people. I could easily see someone taking the cash and gift card back and just walking out.  The way I see it with this location is that they either need to hire new people with experience or do a lot more training. The lack of experience at this location is giving them a bad name.  Definitely won't be returning to this location any time soon.

I heart TGI Friday's....but NOT this location. The food was horrid. I ordered the Jack Daniels shrimp & chicken...the chicken was like rubber and the shrimp tasted like it had been sitting out for hours. Service was fine, with the exception of our server who wore printed nylons which were extremely unprofessional. Looks like she belonged on a stage with a pole instead of waiting tables.

TGI's is one of my fave local restaurant chain's. Sign on to their email list for monthly coupons including buy one get one free. Their jack daniels items are usually quite good, specifically their flat iron steak. The JD dipping sauce for the flat iron is so friggin yum! The sides are decent. They brought back their Oreo Madness dessert, it was a favorite of mine back in 2005. Doesn't taste quite as good now as it used to.

My husband works close by,  and I will meet him here from time to time. It has always been HORRIBLE as far as service goes. Food, ok, if the server can get your order right. But if feels like the staff is constantly socializing and annoyed at the guests. Not very attentive, and there is one server here we had a few times that makes us so incredibly uncomfortable. A very shakey, nervous person, it is almost unbearable. And the one time we asked to see a manager to complain about our apetizers that took 50 to come out, she herself took 20 min to come out, and just wanted to shut us up with discounts and gift cards. Normally very nice gesture, but I'm the kinda gal where 3 strikes u are out. Going to try to convince my husband to go somewhere else from now on.

went there xpecting more varietys too coose from on all u can eat meals but only ended up with 6. also had wait for 10/15mins or more too arrive each round. however service was great an atmosphere an attractions was great.

If I could give this place zero stars, I would.  Yes, all the reviews here saying this place is bad, is spot on.  My husband and 2 kids and I went here on a Sunday evening.  As we waited for the hostess to finish her phone call, we surveyed the place to see how busy they were.  They weren't.  Finally, after 15 mins. the hostess finally finished her phone call & was able to seat us.  Our server was very lacking all around.  He didn't ask for our drinks until about 10 to 15 mins. later, he checked on us ONCE and that was because he happened to be walking by our table (he was on his way to another table).  He charged/brought us the wrong order.  Then later on, gave us a drink we didn't order (belonged to another table).  When it was time to pay, we gave him a gift card, which he didn't bother checking the amount on, so we ended up not using the gift card (He said the balance was zero, which wasn't true, because we checked and the full amount of the gift card was there).  AVOID THIS PLACE!!  If you want to pay for mediocre food coupled with bad customer service, then this is your place.

We went to TGI Friday's after a trip to Legoland - on the way back to LA.  All we wanted was a quick lunch before we headed out on the road.  There were 8 of us; 4 adults and 4 kids.  Granted, we were a large group, it shouldn't have been unmanageable for a large restaurant chain.  We waited about 15 minutes to be seated.  Once seated, it took another 10 minutes to put in lunch orders for the kids.  Then we waited.  And, waited, and waited and waited...about 45 minutes later 2 of the kids orders came to the table.  Mind you, we didn't order complicated dishes.  The kids had simple pasta and cheese pizza orders.  We put our orders in about 35 minutes of waiting and didn't get our food until an entire hour after being at the restaurant.  Any questions we had for the wait staff were given dismissive responses back.  Poor attitude, poor service and tasteless food.  People who came in much after us were served faster.  They had eaten and left while we were still waiting.  The place is HUGE, what's the point of having an enormous space if you can't serve even a fraction of the capacity?  I would not recommend this place, EVER!  I don't think the management cares.  I feel like it's easier to keep it like this because unsuspecting tourists will always try it once.

Only went here because it was the only place serving food after 10pm on a Monday night. Got a ton of food for how much we paid. Liked the side dishes better than the main course. Good variety and late night specials.

Food was decent, but for a large group, service was a bit on the rough side. Servers mixed up orders and double billed several of our group, and tried to put several of the lunch meals down as dinner prices, despite eating at 1 but not leaving until after 3. Would be willing to give it a try again, but I think there are better places in the area that are more willing to focus on the little things to make it a more enjoyable experience overall.

Hadn't been to a TGI Fridays in years.  Went with a group of 12.  It took 15 minutes for the table to get setup and the place was not busy.   The first time the waitress stopped to take drink orders took another 15 minutes.  20 or so minutes later she came and took orders.  No kidding from 12:05 - 12:55 - then it took 25 more minutes to get served.  I asked to see the manager after waiting 1 hour and 20 minutes.  The bus boy asked me to wait while he went into the kitchen.  I followed him in and there I saw the waiters and waitresses preparing the food.  The manager never came out of the kitchen.   After the food was served the "manager" actually come out and apologized but claimed that it only took 25 minutes to prepare our order after the kitchen got the order.  Technically his claim was correct.  Nearly two hour to eat a sandwich that was utter garbage.  A cold, microwaved greez fest prepared with the love of misguided corporate greed.   F.U. TGI Fridays for providing the WORST restaurant experience ever.  NEVER WILL I GO BACK TO THAT SHITHOLE.     F-.

Located by an actual windmill, so drinking and reading Don Quixote is strictly verboten.  Pickings are pretty slim in this part of the North County, so luckily there's TGIF. Food is usually better than I'd expect, and so are the drinks. The best draw for this location is its hours.  There really isn't anything else around that's open to 2 am. I find waiting staff to be too young and inexperienced, but not too badly.

Terrible!  We are a family of five whom all ordered at the same time.  Three entrees show up about 20 minutes after we ordered and all included steaks, two were perfect the other however ended up back in the kitchen.  The other two entrees came 30 minutes after the other entrees were served.  One entree was a steak and the other a kid's chicken tenders.  Yes, my two year old was served his chicken tenders last.  A huge no no when a family is out for a decent meal or at least that was the intention.  The last steak entree was cooked to perfection but the vegetables weren't cooked or seasoned.  I was so ticked off at this point, I just wanted to leave.  I ate my steak and mashed potatoes however left the veggies.  My two year old ate his dinner and the steak that was sent back to the kitchen returned only to still be messed up.  Dessert was served to two at the table while the rest finished up what they had left of their dinner.  The bill was around $110...I will NEVER return to TGI Friday's.  There are much better establishments that are well worth the money.  This definitely is not one of them!

After spending the day at Legoland, we wanted find a nearby and family friendly place to eat.  A friend suggested T.G.I. Fridays, since they already had McDonald's for breakfast and In N Out for lunch which also are nearby this location.  We were seated quickly since the restaurant was mainly empty.  They did have wide benches that seated our group of 4 adults and 4 children well.  We made our selection of food items and made a few changes to the order.  The waiter was quick to say that he got it when I asked him to review.  When the food came, two of the children's meals had the side dishes swapped and a salad was not delivered.  Half the beverages came at the beginning and the other half during the middle of the meal.  The number of cutlery sets was short, but was finally brought after the food was half finished.  The food was pretty standard.  However, I feel the service was lacking.  Any service adjustment had to be prodded out of the waiter.  The missing salad was brought out and not charged, but they charged for fixing the side dishes.  I ask to them to reverse the charge which they did.  The gratuity was included automatically which we paid.  The children had a great time at Legoland and we will go again, but we won't be stopping here again.

my bf and my mom and I went here for dinner for valentines. It was great! my bf got the flat iron steak and they cooked it med  the way he asked. I got the top serlin steak and asked for them to cook it med as well but they cooked it well almost to much it was kinda rubbery... you'd think they'd pay attention to one of the things that is the most pricey on the menu. so for that thats why i gave them 3 stars... . . I have been going to this location for years now and this was the first time this has happend. so maybe they just had a new cook on board.. but for valentines day i would expect more.

Ever week I am bombarded with clever TGI Friday's coupons where I think I'm getting the greatest deal in the world. Ex. Free Appetizer, 1cent entree, bring a friend and save deal. But thats it, they will do anything to get you in.  From the last two visits I would have to say its not worth the 5-8 Dollars you spent on the 15-20 overmarked dish or over 8 dollar small drink they serve. The atmosphere is also filled with other cheapskates like yourself that doesn't add to the sense of value you think you are getting. The waiter was ofcourse rushed and over worked but I thought it was really lousy when he knew we were trying to leave and pay that he just sat with the cute hostess probably trying to get first dibbs at her phone number.  T-try G-going I- Italian instead, there are better coupons for what you will spend at a fancy restaurant than this. Unless you really are a cheapskate and want them to sing you a birthday song.
I Totally Recommend this restaurant. the food was good, the service was excellent and everyone there is really friendly and fast. I will defitnetly go back!!

Initially I gave this place more stars but after the weekend I will NEVER come here again. In recent visits I have had good service and enjoyed myself.  I came here after eating at a neighboring restaraunt. We saw the rear patio opened and helped ourselves to some seats. After speaking to a party outside about the waiter/waitress we came to the conclusion that nobody was serving outside. We proceeded to ask a hostesses to get service she treated us HOSTILE. She questioned where we came from and why we entered through the rear. We were caught off guard because regaurdless we thought they would apreciate our business. Instead we brushed it off and headed to the bar to get some drinks. We sat down and the bar tender asked us what to drink and before we could finish our first round he cut off us off to head to the back. He came back two minutes later to let us know that he would not be serving us!!! WTF!!! How can you make that determination in less than five minutes. We did not argue, and left immediately. I dont want to call it racial profiling but it did feel that way. I did call the management the next day to get explanationi but have yet to receive an explanation for this behavior. So In short I hope this place closes down and i will never go here again nor speak of it. The END

today i visited TGI Fridays for a late lunch our sever Jeremy was great fast and attentive. her took great care of us even the manager came by our table to see how we were doing. i will come back to this restaurant.

This place sucks.  The only thing that was good here was the beer...and that is very hard to mess up.  The service was horrible.  The waitress brought our appetizer out after 20 min and didnt even bring silverware or plates, we had to walk to the bar and get our own plates!  I would give this place 0 stars if possible.

I went with my a group of 15. It took 20 minutes for them to seat us and another 20 to take our drink orders. Our waitress was a real itch!! Service was very poor but the food was good. Background music was playing too loud we had to yell when we were talking. Very sad experience I won't be coming back to this location.

With so many good restaurants in the area I usually avoid this one. Occasionally I get suckered into visiting this location, and always do not enjoy it. My last trip was the worst. The food is always sub-par and everything is pre-made (including the drinks, which are too sugary). A guest in my group asked for a quesadilla without sausage, and she was told they couldn't remove the sausage because the item came pre-made. Another person in my group ordered a drink that is promoted at another T.G.I.F's and no one in the bar could figure out how to make it, nor did they even attempt. Our waiter was really erratic and had to come back several times to confirm our orders. By the time the music started blaring at a deafening level, we could not wait to get out of there.
Buy one get one free coupon. Might as well eat there. The Jack Daniels sauce is great. The ribs are better than you would expect.

Even after bad experiences at other TGI Friday locations, a few things on the menu, draw me back time after time. For example: The Tostada Nachos (Appetizers) and The Jack Daniels Burger (make sure you pour on that yummy Jack Daniel's Sauce). YUM!! Order either of these two and I guarantee you will not be disappointed.  The only reason I did not give them 5 stars is because I ordered my burger with no onions and I still found 2 onions on the burger. Also I ordered my nachos with the jalapenos on the side but instead the didn't bring them at all. -1 star. The food was delicious though, and A+ service!

I went here quite a few times and never really had a bad experience. I never had to wait to be seated, and the food was usually on point and prompt. The waitresses were helpful and polite, and the food was satisfactory. I'd recommend it.
Their Jack Daniels dishes are so good.  Try the Jack Daniels Tower appetizer.  Yum!  They have a low carb menu, too.
